Dear Huron Academy Family and Friends,

Every year the Parent/Teacher Club (PTC) tirelessly raises funds for our school through many activities, programs and gatherings throughout the school year. This year, however, is very different. Due to covid-19 and restrictions from the state of Michigan, we are unable to put in place any gatherings or fundraisers until the end of the year. We will revisit any and all activities beginning in January 2021.

Even with these specific restrictions, the PTC is happy to announce that our fundraising efforts through the sale of Huron Academy spirit wear will go on throughout the school year. Please visit CuttingEdgeEmbroidery.com to place all your orders.

Thank you Huron family and friends for your understanding and support throughout the years and please bear with us as we navigate these rough times along with you all.

Respectfully yours,

Huron Academy PTC

ICE CREAM IN A BAG üç¶

Mix a little science and fun in the kitchen with this simple ice cream in a bag activity!

This easy recipe only requires:
1 cup half and half cream (10% M.F)
1.5 tsp vanilla extract
1 tbsp sugar
Ice üßä
1/4 cup salt üßÇ
Sealed top bags - 1 small, 1 large

Pour the ingredients into a small bag and seal tightly. To prevent salty ice cream, you can double bag it. Fill the large bag half way with ice. üßä Add 1/4 cup of salt. Then add your small bag into the large and fill with extra ice on top. Seal the large bag.

Shake with oven mitt gloves üß§ on.

Important ‚ùóÔ∏è The salt makes the ice extra cold so you must wear thick gloves. Shake for 6 minutes. Rinse the outside of the small bag with cold water before opening. Enjoy!

See the full post and tips here: https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/ice-cream-in-a-bag/

Meet Mrs. Harkonen. Mrs. Harkonen is Huron Academy's technology teacher for grades K-2. Many students, especially Kindergarteners are just beginning to use computers, iPads, and other devices. This is not an obstacle for Mrs. Harkonen. She has a great deal of patience and this shows in her kind and gentle manner. Mrs. Harkonen is truly vested in Huron Academy and we are proud to have her on our team.

Have you met Mr. Achs? Mr. Achs is in charge of computer classes at our Utica campus. Which means he teaches everything from Microsoft Office to video editing and web design. A jack of all trades, and master of most, Mr. Achs is known for his help throughout both buildings in terms of technology, being an advocate for digital literacy amongst staff, students, and parents (he has done many tutorials for our recent online learning procedures) as well as being a major part of our state testing. His devotion to student success is unrivaled, and his contributions to Huron Academy are immeasurable. Thank you for your great work Mr. Achs!

#whyiteach #teacherspotlight
